column5: the lake opened up on Sunday and have only seen 1 boat on it so far, and that was to rescue some drifting docks. I only make the spinners, playing with lead for large production items can be hazardous to your health if you don't have the proper safety equipment. (i do make my own jigs and weights).
Wondering if any native Canadians could tell me what 100, 1/4 or 3/8 oz. jigs go for in Canada (in U.S. dollars-if that makes sense).
if you are looking at plain jigs about $.35 US ($.55 canadian). If you want the fancy paint jobs or whistle type they are about $1. US each at your local canadian tackle store.
Gull Rock, heard you've had open water! Also, do you make jigs in addition to your spinners?
If you buy them at a tackle shop you will get tagged big time. Buy your jigs off of ebay, you will save a great deal.

No, I make my own jigs. My question was out of curiousity. I know you can get 100 of the same color jig from Cabela's or BPS for around $15 + shipping, but was wondering what they went for at Canadian Tire or anywhere else they are cheap. My question would be in reference to painted roundhead jigs.
100 1 colour $20-$25 ($17.65 us-$22.10us) 100 2 tone $25-$30 ($22.10us-$26.50us) manitoba .... a 100,000 lakes how many walleyes ???? i will never have enough time....
100 1 colour $20-$25 ($17.65 us-$22.10us) 100 2 tone $25-$30 ($22.10us-$26.50us) manitoba .... a 100,000 lakes how many walleyes ???? i will never have enough time....
Most places, if you want to buy 100, it's like $0.20/jig. NWO Fishing Bum
Most places, if you want to buy 100, it's like $0.20/jig. NWO Fishing Bum

the lake opened up on Sunday and have only seen 1 boat on it so far, and that was to rescue some drifting docks. I only make the spinners, playing with lead for large production items can be hazardous to your health if you don't have the proper safety equipment. (i do make my own jigs and weights).
